article.headline: Dayton 72, St. Louis 70 (OT)
article.story: ST. LOUIS (AP) -- Monty Scott scored seven of his game-high 23 points in overtime, leading Dayton to 72-70 Atlantic 10 Conference victory over Saint Louis on Wednesday night. Dayton (14-15 overall, 6-9 Atlantic 10) snapped a seven-game road losing streak. Warren Williams had 14 and Charles Little added 10 points for Dayton, which won a 46-44 home game earlier this season over the Billikens (16-11, 10-5). Kevin Lisch led Saint Louis with 18 points, Ian Vouyoukas had 17 and Anthony Drejaj added 14. Lisch hit a jumper to tie the game at 70 with 38 seconds left in overtime, but was called for a foul with 5.9 seconds left to send Scott to the free-throw line for the game-winning points. Regulation ended with the teams tied at 62. There were four ties and four lead changes in the second half. Dayton built a 14-point lead with 8:22 left in the first half, connecting on six of seven three-pointers. But the Billikens forced Dayton into eight turnovers during a 19-2 run that gave Saint Louis a 34-31 lead with a minute left in the half. A 3-point shot by Dayton's Desmond Adedeji tied it before the break.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
